content: the next row double_crochet into the same space as the chain 3 you just made work as standard doing 2dc in the center of the last scale to make the increase do a last v st in the left corner of the last scale below turn work your first scale into this v st do scales as normal back around and a scale in the 2nd to last v st then slip_stitch into the last v st row 28-31 repeat row 18 and 17 row 32-33 repeat row 26-27 repeat the combination as many times as you wish an increase is done after every 4 row until it gets to the desired width then continue making row until it is the desired length for an adult 42 from bottom to top is enough to make the top do 6 double_crochet sts in the center of each shell and a slip_stitch in each v st between the shells tail fhdc 40-60 sts depending on the size of your blanket row 2 ch1 and turn skip the first stitch slip_stitch into the blo of the 2nd stitch single_crochet in the blo of the 3rd stitch and half_double_crochet into the blo of the 4th stitch this will be the last st of the next row half_double_crochet in the blo to the end row 3 chain 2 and turn half_double_crochet in the blo across doing your last st in the 4 th st of the previous row chain 1 and turn repeat row 2-3 until your width is half the size of your length make a second panel exactly the same as the first they are reversible leave a tail on the straight edge top of each tail panel using the tail you left weave it in and out along the top creating a draw string pull it to bunch up the top and create folds fasten_off and repeat on the other panel place the panels side by side using the short side of each panel the points of the panels should point down on the outside bring the two short sides together and use your preferred method to sew them together side by side weave in ends insert the finished find into the bottom tube of the tail and sew it in place
